intro: Schiedea pubescens, commonly known as the hairy schiedea, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems covered in fine, white hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in coastal and lowland habitats. Schiedea pubescens is a rare and endangered species, highlighting the unique biodiversity of Hawaii's flora.
